```{r Step_1, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE}
# Remove All Variable
rm(list = ls())

# Load Required Functions:

           "PerformanceAnalytics", "miscor", "outliers")

data <- read.csv(file = "data/Data_Test_34.csv", header = TRUE)

```

```{r Step_2, fig.width=4, fig.height=4, dpi=600}
# Assumption Checking:
# 1. It is assumed that the K samples are taken from normally distributed populations.

# Use Shapiro-Wilk Normality Test:
shapiro.test(x = data$Yield)

# Normality Plot:
ggqqplot(data = data$Yield, ylab = "Yield (kg/ha)")

# Visualize Data Using Density Plot:
ggplot(data = data, aes(x = "", y = Yield)) +
  geom_boxplot() + 
  ylab(label = "Yield (kg/ha)") + 
  xlab(label = "Khorasan Razavi")
```

```{r Step_3}
# Method 1:---------------------------------------------------------------------
# Setting Initial Parameter Values:
set.seed(seed = 1)
n = n1 = n2 = n3 = n4 = n5 = 25
k = 5

d1 = data %>% sample_n(size = n1) %>% select(Yield) %>% unlist()
v1 = var(x = d1)

d2 = data %>% sample_n(size = n2) %>% select(Yield) %>% unlist()
v2 = var(x = d2)

d3 = data %>% sample_n(size = n3) %>% select(Yield) %>% unlist()
v3 = var(x = d3)

d4 = data %>% sample_n(size = n4) %>% select(Yield) %>% unlist()
v4 = var(x = d4)

d5 = data %>% sample_n(size = n5) %>% select(Yield) %>% unlist()
v5 = var(x = d5)

v = c(v1, v2, v3, v4, v5)

# Test Statistic
C = max(v) / sum(v)

# Compute the critical values at 0.05 significance level (two tailed).
alpha = 0.05
criVal = qcochran(p = (1 - alpha), n = n, k = k)

# P-value (Two Tailed).
two.sided = TRUE
p_value = 1 - pcochran(q = C, n = n, k = k)

cat("Test Statistic: ", C, "\n")
cat("Critical Values: ", criVal, "\n")
cat("P-value: ", p_value, "\n")

# Method 2:---------------------------------------------------------------------
# setting initial parameter values:

# use "cochran.test" function from "outliers" package
cochran.test(object = v, 
             data = rep(x = n, k),
             inlying = FALSE)
```
